channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Over hanging tree needs pruning on Palace View, 23rd June
item.description:
The tree outside 106/108 Palace View requires pruning as the branches are too low and pedestrians have to duck under the tree. The tree branches are also overhanging the driveways shedding leaves and tree sap onto the cars and driveway, therefore causing damage

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Palace View, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car untaxed since 01May25 abandoned on public road, 23rd June
item.description:
Photo taken 22nd June 2025. Car has been dumped here for many months. You can see it on street view in same spot in 2024. Car is untaxed for almost 2 months now. It’s got markings indicating it’s from a garage. It’s obstructing a public road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Vernham Road, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Please clear this rubbish, 23rd June
item.description:
This bin outside Plumstead train station has not been emptied and now had other bags of rubbish building up next to it. It started on Friday and smells bad. Please collect this rubbish. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Walmer Terrace, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nitrous Oxide Canister, 23rd June
item.description:
Nitrous oxide canister at the front of his house at 87 Blenden road DA5 1BP. The item is about 14 inchs long and 4 inch is diameter, about the length of a mans arm . Please can we inspect.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 88, Blendon Road, Bexley, London

item.title: Rubbish and litter all down the pavement and in the roadside, 23rd June
item.description:

item.title: Dead and disease trees, 23rd June
item.description:
A dead eucalyptus and sycamore and two Sooty Bark–infected sycamores in 42 Powerscroft Road’s garden are unstable and could crash into neighbouring gardens. The disease has already reached 36, so urgent felling and treatment are needed to stop dying trees.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Blurton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
